intro: Tetrouratea selloi, commonly known as the Sello's tetrouratea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
